**To Reproduce**
Code to reproduce the behaviour:
```cython
```

```
$ pip --version
```

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Linux, Windows, macOS]
 - Python version [e.g. 3.8.4]
 - Cython version [e.g. 0.29.18]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

https://github.com/davidstutz/mesh-fusion/issues/7

comment_data.body:
This was fixed at https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/1955. You probably have old c files laying around that were built with a non-3.7 compatible version of Cython: 

```
skipping 'cyfusion.cpp' Cython extension (up-to-date)
```

title: [BUG] cyfusion.cpp:24028:21: error: ‘PyThreadState’ {aka ‘struct _ts’} has no member named ‘exc_type’; did you mean ‘curexc_type’?
